Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery wide-bodied cup; interior: glazed (only traces remaining); exterior: traces of two painted (fired brown) bands above four rays rising from narrow band above small ring foot; traces of glaze on inside of foot and on underside, which has a groove around the edge.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 97, no. A138)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.228) (phase 3)
